titleStmt.title: English Presbytery, or, An account of the main opinions of those ministers and people in England, who go under the name of Presbyterians published for the vindication of divers noble and worthy persons, who by papists, and their adherents are without any ground aspersed with that name : and also of those who indeed do hold those principles, appealing to the judgement of all sober Christians, what there is of falshood or unpeaceableness in them.

English Presbytery, or, An account of the main opinions of those ministers and people in England, who go under the name of Presbyterians published for the vindication of divers noble and worthy persons, who by papists, and their adherents are without any ground aspersed with that name : and also of those who indeed do hold those principles, appealing to the judgement of all sober Christians, what there is of falshood or unpeaceableness in them.
titleStmt.author: Collinges, John, 1623-1690.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained, with print show-through and loss of print.
This item is identified as Wing C5315 at reel 1148:50 and as Wing E3114 (cancelled in Wing (2nd ed.)) at reel 867:14.
